alert.note: Alert for East Carteret (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 3:16PM EDT until May 28 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO 10 AM EDT SUNDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM FRIDAY TO 8 PM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, strong longshore currents in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 2 to 3 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 8 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...East Carteret County. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, until 8 PM EDT this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 10 AM Friday to 10 AM EDT Sunday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 5 PM Friday to 8 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Strong longshore currents will create dangerous swimming conditions.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Strong longshore currents can sweep swimmers and surfers into rip currents, piers, jetties and other hazardous areas. In many cases, the longshore current is strong enough to prevent swimmers from being able to keep their feet on the bottom making it difficult to return to shore.
